content.question: Which of the following best describes the behavior of the code segment?

choices.label: When num is a negative odd integer, "X" is printed; otherwise, "Y" is printed.
When num is a positive even integer, "X" is printed; otherwise, "Y" is printed.
When num is a positive even integer, "X" is printed; when num is a positive odd integer, "Y" is printed; otherwise, nothing is printed.
When num is a positive odd integer, "X" is printed; when num is a positive even integer, "Y" is printed; otherwise, nothing is printed.

content.answer: When num is a positive even integer, "X" is printed; when num is a positive odd integer, "Y" is printed; otherwise, nothing is printed.

skill.text: 4.A: Describe the behavior of a code segment or program.
